Reviews.Content: If you value your health....DO NOT GO!!!!! We arrived in Florence after spending 3 lovely days in Lake Garda. This is quite the possibly, no hang on a minute it is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in in. My lovely new wife also shares my views. We stayed on the 5th floor. No way on earth this hotel is 3 star. Room was very small. A/C was rubbish, like a hamster blowing through a straw. The toilet smelled and the shower also flooded the toilet. The only plus point it did have good views of the Tuscan countryside.If you value your sanity do not visit this place. As the A/C was poor we left the window open....big mistake......I had at least 30 midgie bites all over my body, still have then now, nearly 2 weeks after I visited. We had planned to stay in here for 2 nights but decided that one was enough and went to Pisa.
Reviews.Author: westiefergus76

Reviews.Content: Truly a Disapointment We arived quite late in the evening from Venice where we had a nice stay. Three of us myself , my sister and her partner. We had booked a single and a double room. The hotel lobby started to send warning signals but up we went to our respective rooms. As soon as I went into the room I had this overwhelming impression of being dirty. The room stank ,the walls looked in need of a good clean and a paint job, I didnt want to even sit on the bed !! I was wondering what to do when my sister came in looking devastated. Her room was as equally appalling. We went to the reception asking for different rooms, inspected two others but found them as equally dismal. We checked out immediately and moved up the road to another hotel. How does Ascot get its 3 star rating there was no way it compared to any of the 3 star hotels we stayed in while in Italy. It resembles more of a Doss house than a 3 star hotel. Thank goodness we had the sense to check out and not stay for the breakfast!!!!Jan and Karen from New Zealand
Reviews.Author: KAZJA

Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel, worst I have stayed in, don't stay here! We stayed here on our honeymoon, and it was the worst hotel of our whole trip. When I book hotels now, I think of this place and hope and pray that it is not like this place. Because of this place, I spend hours searching for hotels, reading reviews and convince my husband we should spend a little more on the hotel. When we first booked our accommodation, I hadn't discovered Trip Advisor - I wish I had.I don't think I am fussy when it come to hotels, I am happy with a small bathroom, singles beds, basic breakfast, a bit of noise, just give me a clean and comfortable hotel.The SMELL in this place was HORRENDOUS. The bathroom stank of sewerage, I put a towel and chair over the drain to try and stop the smell, but it still stank out the room. We bought a can of air freshener, but it didn't help for long. We had a smoking room, and my husband hates me smoking, but he let me smoke in the room to help mask that smell.The bed was so uncomfortable, sagging and springs sticking out like it was decades old. The decor was old, stained and peeling, the floor was vinyl.The staff were rude, abrupt and unhelpful.When I think of Florence, I now think of this place which is sad, as I really enjoyed the rest of Florence.
Reviews.Author: vegiemite6

Reviews.Content: The people who liked this place are crazy We read the bad reviews too late, but figured it was just people being snobby. We're pretty easy to please, we thought. Dear god, what a dive. The only way this place is 3 stars is if they bribed someone. The rooms are small, the shower flooded the bathroom every time you used it and the air conditioning unit is a theory at best. The staff lost our reservations, so that was a good 15 minutes of panicking as well.And when we were checking out, their Visa machine wouldn't take either of our Three credit cards. The manager thoughtfully suggested that we must have just overspent on our limits and told us to go get some cash from the machine up the street. When I told her the limit on the cards were quite significant, she just rolled her eyes.After confirming the cards worked just fine (all three of them) we went back and told them. Still no luck. So we ended up paying in Euros.Just a frustrating experience. We would never go there again nor would we recommend anyone else go there. Rude, poor service, lousy rooms. There are plenty of other hotels in the area. They have to be better than this place.
Reviews.Author: Transmet

Reviews.Content: Location location location This hotel is walking distance to the train station, the markets, the shopping precint, the Art museum where David is kept, great restaraunts.... everything! the hotel itself is quite nice and has breakfast room. the staff speak english and are friendly. the rooms are well kept and the only thing I didn't like was the shower which flooded the bathroom! but who cares? this hotel is great value!
Reviews.Author: LynnieAus

Reviews.Content: just dont. they don't know their asses from their elbows. i walked in on my second night in florence to find a new place to stay and the gentleman at reception showed me room 204 and told me it would be 120 euros for the following two nights. GREAT, i thought. but when i went to check in the next morning, they had no booking under my name, NO PAYMENT RECEIPT and no rooms! they say theyd never do bookings for the price i was promised. even worse - i hadnt been offered a receipt - but had signed for the booking. ofcorse i had booked out of the hotel i was staying at and everything around was fully booked (pitti was on) and i had no where to stay with my 73 year old father. they called their sister hotel - airone - and said they had a room available for 150 euros for that night that they would hold for me. i told them i was going to see what i could find elsewhere and something slightly cheaper. i got a room at the hotel i was staying at previously and went back there.i come home. everything is fine until i check my statement and i have been charged 150 euros for the sister hotel that i did not even SEE let alone stay in. i am VERY angry. how did they manage to charge me if i hadn't signed for airone hotel?! they obviously had my booking receipt from the night before for ascot. just don't bother. the road its on isn't very nice.and the lady manager is incredibly rude.
Reviews.Author: MariaA

Reviews.Content: Terrible Booked room online in Australia. I checked in and on inspection of room, I walked straight out; no way could I stay there. The room was tiny, and bathroom even tinier. Bathroom also had really bad odour. There is no way this is even a one star rating, so how they got a 3 star rating is anyones guess. Definitely not worth staying here, especially if you have travelled along way to visit Firenze.
Reviews.Author: keentraveller57

Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised After reading the reviews I was naturally concerned, but decided to go along with the bookong and make my own judgement. I found myself very pleasantly surprised. My single room was clean and spaciuos. Furnishings basic but adequate. The shower was powerful with plenty of hot water. The shower draining into an opening in the floor is not uncommon in Mediterranean countries. The floor was dry ina matter of minutes. Breakfast was simple but adequate, the coffee paticularly good. The staff were welcoming and helpful.I can particularly reccomend the Trattoria immediately opposite the hotel. The food is excellent and inexpensive. I would visit this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: Mabel49

Reviews.Content: DO NOT Stay Here! I glanced at a few reviews before I left on holidays but thought the terrible reports that this hotel had received were by snobby tourists who didn't like a bit of local culture on holidays. No Way!The first room they tried to put us in was a joke.Literally just enough room for the bed and about a 24 inches of space around it. TV hanging off the wall over the bed and held in place with a chain. Electrical wires coming out of the wall(not sure if they were live or not, didn't hang around long enough to find out). The shower in the bathroom had no base so water just flies all over the place, just a hole in the floor! We went downstairs and said we wanted to be moved in a polite manner. After that we were treated quite badly by all members of the staff(who are some of the unfriendliest people i've ever met). Definitely not a 3 star! Horrible.Moved to lovely 4 star on the edge of town called Villa Gabrielle D'Annuncio where the staff were lovely and the rooms were beautiful. Even had a lovely pool outside(with a diving board) and only cost about 鈧?0 extra a night.
Reviews.Author: RosieBollix

Reviews.Content: Were we lucky! Having booked this hotel before reading the reviews we were a little concerned, however after arriving and being checked in by an english speaking girl we found our room to be adequate. Bearing in mind we only paid 拢21 each for bed and breakfast the room was better than some BB's we have stayed at in the UK. Our room was on the first floor and looked out on to the street, during the night it was quiet but after 6.30 in the morning traffic noise was to be heard but remember you are in the middle of a busy city. The beds were comfortable, linen clean however the furniture and the decor was a little tired but for all the time we were in the room it didn't bother us.We had no nasty smells from our bathroom and the shower which did spray over everything else in the room was powerful and there was plenty of hot water. I have stayed in Italy before and this seems to be how they sometimes set out bathrooms.Breakfast was plentiful and we had no complaints about it although we didn't try the hard boiled eggs!There are several good restaurants near by if you wish to eat out at night and the food is superb.All in all for the money the Ascot served us well and it is very close to the bus and train stations. I think the secret to going to Florence is to go out of season, yes it is still busy but it can cope better with less people around.
Reviews.Author: drumdmc

Reviews.Content: Absolutely dreadful - Not a 3* hotel by anyones standards PLEASE READ THIS REVIEW BEFORE BOOKING THIS HOTELWhere do I start - Arrived Thursday 13th Sept - left Monday 17th Sept 2007.There is not a single thing good about this 'Hotel'. Had 2 rooms booked - 1 for my sister and I, the other for my parents.If I had the cash to be able to 're-home' all of us, I definitely would have. Reception - uninviting and serviced by people who showed little or no interest - e.g. requested a light bulb for the toilet / shower - there was no other light - was told it would happen the next day as they had no bulbs - it was never done.The rooms - miserable  dark. Paint chipped, tile floors - lacked comfort and very uninviting - the blue bed spreads were not clean.The bathroom - tiny - toilet come shower. The toilet dripped throughout the night.Breakfast - forget it - I didn't bother after the first morning - cardboard croissants / no taste rubber cheese / ham - coupled with busy hot room. Air Con - didn't work - you had to leave the windows open at night as it was so hot in the room. Got bitten several times (I am hoping from something flying around NOT something in the bed!)Location - On a busy road down from the main station - feel like I haven't slept for 4 nights as it was so loud.I am a firm believer that you get what you pay for - this was not a hugely expensive hotel, but the 3* grading was completely misleading. If this is a 3* standard in Florence then travellers need to be aware that it is not what the English would grade as 3* - I would definitely have looked for a 4* had I known !Not only did I not sleep at night, but there was also nowhere comfortable to relax and re-charge - you felt that you wanted to get out of the hotel as quickly as possible.Have left feeling very sad for my parents as this is their 1 holiday a year and it wasn't at all relaxing.
Reviews.Author: LondonFlorence

Reviews.Content: Don't stay here A terrible hotel in a generally poor state of upkeep and repair. Although the hotel is advertised as a three star the official hotel guide from the tourist office has it as a two star.I booked the hotel prior to reading the reviews, ran out of time to cancel and rebook - big mistake. The room was very poor and extremely noisy. Air conditioning very noisy and can't be switched off, all windows in corridor are left open letting in all the noise from the streets outside. If you can sleep through anything, on anything and like to pay over the odds for the privilege this is the hotel for you, otherwise avoid.
Reviews.Author: fireplug42

Reviews.Content: One star-hotel maybe-three star-No way! When I arrived I was confronted with a lousy-Englishspeaking guy at the reception-it turned out only one (kind)girl could speak some English-the rest didn't. Size of room was okay but bathroom very small-I couldn't sit on the toilet properly. Airco (still) didn't work at all - just made a lot of noise at an average temperature of 37 degrees during the four days I was in Florence at the end of July. Breakfast was downright disgusting - cheese and very fat bacon which looked as if it had been lying out of a fridge for a day and hardboiled eggs with a green middle! Very dangerous altogether indeed!!! Although they claim to be a threestar-hotel......THEY'RE NOT!! Onestar maybe - on a lucky day!!! I'll never go here again!
Reviews.Author: Lizzy95

Reviews.Content: Enough to ruin your holiday Booked this hotel online from Australia, luckily only for one night. The cost was 95 EUR. Upon entering the room the first thing I noticed was the two fold-up trundle beds they classed as a double, which were obviously put there before the walls went in.The next thing was the sewerage stench coming from the bathroom. I had to wet a towell and place it over the bathroom drain to stem the wretched odour emanating from the pipes.The hotel staff refused to acknowledge the issues. An absolutely disgusting experience. I would have rather have slept on the street. This is a genuine review from a person who is not too fussy. It is the first time I have felt the need to actually write a review to warn fellow travellers.
Reviews.Author: travelinstevo

Reviews.Content: Sigh - not a 3-star standard The hotel is good in location - it's close to the railway statation and it takes only 7-8 mins to walk there directly.But the hotel is not at 3 star standard. This is a family hotel, the reception old man cannot speak English and it's hard to communicate with him. when we asked where the nearest shop for a drink and fast food, he unfolded a map and point at almost evreywhere on the map - FAINT! We booked a double room for one single bed. but the room they provide has 3 single small beds. and we asked for change, then you guess what happened when we got back at night - they put two beds together and make one bed~ FANIT again!The bathroom is big, but there is only shower, not bath tub. the hot water must have been used up by a big group of students. cold shower that night.TV is too small hanged up on the wall, cannot see clearly.Not better than a hostel.
Reviews.Author: littlepandabighead

Reviews.Content: The bathroom was the shower!       The lovely bathroom
Reviews.Author: kristokriech

Reviews.Content: The Worst Hotel in Florence       I've seen bigger kennels
Reviews.Author: PeterandJean

Reviews.Content: Absolutely horrible hotel!! This is probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. When we arrived there, the person at the front desk could only find our reservation for that night and could not locate our reservation for the next two nights, so we had no idea if we had a place to stay. The hotel website claims that the hotel has air conditioning but of course it wasn't working (which is no surprise based on other reviews I've read). The room was small and not very clean. The floor was not carpeted and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. The bathroom had a drain in the middle of the floor, with the toilet/bidet on one side and the sink on the other side. The shower curtain didn't reach all the way around the room so we either had a wet toilet or a wet sink after taking a shower. Water from the bathroom would seep under the door into the bedroom when we would take a shower (which could explain why there are no carpets). We had to keep the bathroom door closed at all times because it smelled like a public restroom. The second day we were there, the hotel staff were finally able to locate our reservations but by then we had already found a room at a different hotel because we were afraid that they had lost our reservation. They did not charge us for cancelling our room less than 24 hours in advance, but that was the least they could do considering that they weren't competent enough to locate our reservation in the first place. The most ridiculous part is that the room cost 190 Euro per night. In the US, I would not pay more than $40 per night for this hotel, and that is being generous.I would never recommend this hotel to anyone under any circumstances!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Do NOT take a safety deposit box key Hotel Ascot Florence24th May -31st MayMargaret JohnsonMy friend and I stayed at this hotel, decided mainly on its proximity to Santa Maria Novella station. We asked for a safety deposit box and we were presented with a key for the box in the wardrobe in our room. We duly put our passports and Euros ijn the box, locked it and took the key with us. Night 2 we were organising money and things for next day and discovered we had 90 euros in total, missing from our box. We had been keeping a running total so we both knew what we had. Next morning we asked to speak to the Manager-not available till Monday. When we reported our loss to desk clerk, after checking the rota and uumming and aahing she immediately said it was not possible as there was not a duplicate key. We made a report to the police, who were more helpful than the hotel. The manageress also maintained there was not a duplicate key,and did not seem in the least bit perturbed that a member of staff was probably a thief. The hotel are either niave or they do know they have a theft problem and are unwilling to go public. One wonders why.Copy of police report is available from me and the hotel also has a copy. If this review prevents anyone else from being robbed inside the hotel then it has done its job.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Warning! Absolutely Awful! My family stayed at Hotel Ascot after booking and prepaying on the internet. The hotel claims to have a 3* rating but these most probably stand for: grumpy staff, horrible room and gross smell. We booked two rooms. My parent's room was ok - fairly pokey with very old furniture, but clean. The room given to my sister and I was foul - extremely small and dark, looking out onto a grotty yard. The beds were awful - almost like two camp beds pushed together with the springs jutting out. The room smelt of rotten eggs and was humid despite the air-conditioning. The bathroom was small and to my dismay I found pubic hairs on the toilet seat, bidet and sink. I was astounded. The next morning I spotted a room come available that was much nicer and requested to change. This was fine with the staff. I was surprised to see that both rooms were the same price despite being so different. The furniture was still old and smelly, but at least the new room was lighter and didn't smell so bad. We decided to stay as we had prepaid for the rooms. Breakfast was a major disappointment - stale bread, cheap cornflakes, juice (cordial) and croissants that were not very nice. I was surprised that there was no cheese, meat or fruit offered. If this wasn't bad enough, my family were shouted at by the breakfast lady for sitting at the wrong table and then I was shouted at another time for requesting a spoon! It appears that when all the 7 or 8 table are full there is not enough cutlery for the guests - unbelievable! All requests in the dining room are treated as causing a nuisance. Apalling service. Florence was beautiful but I was thoroughly disappointed with the hotel. Always check trip advisor before you book anywhere! I know we will.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It is a SHAME!!! Well, this hotel is everything but a 3 star one.I would like to state that I work in tourism, I exactly know what a three star hotel is and that I could have made a big problem to this hotel if I hadn't been rather focused on Florence itself.They can only get away because I prefered keeping calm and not ruining my whole day with making fuss.Nor the hotel, nor the rooms nor the service nor the attitude is suitable and worth the money!!! By the way, all documents in the hotel have the sign: 2 stars. Except for the entrance and the internet sites.I had the chance to see two rooms since the first one was not acceptable (and the second one I only kept because I wanted to start sightseeing in Florence). In some of the booking sites room photos are available, well, I wonder where those were made, because they have nothing to do with reality.Take off curtains, all kind of decoration, carpet and colourful paint of the walls. What you get is a cell...The first room I was given faced the inner yard, no light and the worst kitchen smell despite windows closed. Very small and low bed.The second one was a little better but still:- much noise from the street and from the hotel too, for God's sake, insulation is already invented!!- traditional furniture means a 50-year-old stinky wooden wardrobe, that I prefered not to open even. Of course I had all my clothes in the suitcase for 4 days- plain white walls, not even one picture, but several marks on it, plus a huge chewing gum by the light-switch. When you wanted to switch the light on there was a a great chance of touching it.- switches and plugs are about 40 years old...- the mirror was in a stylish old stucco frame, which is a nice idea itself. But that was all over broken, pieces missing, so it just added to the old, over-used feeling.- no mini-bar and no glasses in the room, so I had to cut a plastic bottle in half and feel like in a survival camp... - for the minibar, they had a funny explanation: problem with the supply... So I went to the other side of the street and bought a bottle of water. - there was no clean blanket so I used the bed cover...- the dustbin was broken and did not open with the pedal- the only bed was a portable extra bed- bathroom equipment: soap, shower gel and cap. Only the first day, afterwards I had to ask for replacement. - despite cleaning floor tiles (no carpet) remained dirty, sheets unchanged.- breakfast was rather poor.- I had to run the water for about 10 minutes to have hot water, but then I realised that what I didn't have was cold water, I mean no pressure, so I several times burnt my hands...- spider (4 cm) in the room...- one morning at 8:00 they called a plumber to fix a room. Imagine the noise... After all these I wonder:- did they just change to 3 star and forgot to inform all the stuff?or- are they just taking us for fools?
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not very good We were given a tiny room on arrival which had a water tank in the ceiling which began to fill up every time someone in the hotel flushed a toilet. The noise continued intermittently all night long. We complained about the room and were offered a choice of two more. We accepted one of them and after the first room it seemed fairly pleasant apart from the furniture which appeared to be from a second hand furniture shop. The bed heads were moth-eaten and generally shabby. The en-suite facilities consisted of a shower head with no curtain and the water sprayed over the toilet seat and bidet and flowed under the door into the bedroom. The bedroom window looked out into a dingy alley and opposite were the bedrooms of people in other hotel rooms. We could see people below laying on their beds and others above us could see us too. The breakfast room was small and shabby and we had to pass a bathroom door just before entry but had to hold our breath as the stench emanating from it was enough to make a horse retch. The breakfast itself consisted of a choice of cornflakes, croissants and slices of stale bread. We found it hilarious that the fruit juice was a very watery cordial. How the owners could not hide their faces in shame amazed us. There were other disappointments such as asking when the bar would open to be told curtly, no bar! despite a notice to the contrary. We survived the holiday despite The Ascot which doesn't deserve one star never mind three! Florence is a beautiful city and it deserves to be better served. What a shame to leave Italy with a sour memory!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Very bad All the reviews here are accurate- I'm just sorry I read them after I booked and paid for the room here. There were two of us traveling together, but we got a room with three beds. The first bed had a stain on it. I suspect it was blood, but I am not sure. It was on the mattress bad, but it was visible through the white fitted sheet. Regardless, we refused to sleep on that bed. The second bed sagged terribly in the middle. The third bed broke when my brother laid on it because it was missing half of the wooden slats on the bed frame (the remaining ones had been angled, but as soon as any weight was put on the bed they fell out). We ended up putting the mattress on the floor for the night. The air conditioning that was advertised did not work. We played around with it and it made noise, but there was no cold air. There were dead bugs on the walls. The floor was dirty- I took off my socks and shoes to cool down and the bottom of my feet were filthy from walking around the room. There was no shower curtain in the bathroom (basically there was a toilet, sink and shower head with a drain in the floor), so we had to take everything out to avoid making a huge mess. In the morning I saw ants on the floor as well. What little we slept we did with the lights on because of what I had read about the cockroaches (we never saw any cockroaches though). The staff was not dressed professionally, nor did I feel they acted very professionally. Breakfast was okay- neither exciting nor bad, except that it was blazing hot in the breakfast room. How this hotel ever got a 3 star rating is beyond me. The hotel is not worth the price at all- I'm sure there's something nicer in Florence for this kind of money. It really ruined our day there. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
Reviews.Author: Lorrxa99

Reviews.Content: Lousy In an attempt to get away from another nasty Florence 鈥済uest house鈥? we found this hotel at a moment's notice. The only amenity I requested was air conditioning and they told me they had it. When we checked in to the room, the A/C only had an on/off switch (no temp control) and there was no cool air coming from the A/C, so it hardly worked. The room itself was tiny, not the cleanest we鈥檇 seen, full of mosquitoes, but it least it had a decent city view. Good thing we only had to tolerate this place for one night.
Reviews.Author: DerickS

Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY!!!!!! One of the most terrible hotel and certainly the most disgusting hoetl I have ever stayed!!!Do not stay here!! AVOID!!I arrived late night and was pleased to find a room. The room looked very old and sad but it did look OK for just couple of nights.BUT!, when I was ready to sleep. As I took off the bed cover , I found the big milky grey mark on the other side of the bed cover. When I touched the mark was still half wet!!!!!!! yack!I went to the reception but the guy (night porter) refused to change the sheets for me, because it was not his job. However I managed to bring him to my room to check the darty wet mark I found on my bed. When he saw the mark and touched and smelled it, he finally understood what was it. And clearly he was embarassed. (well....I was embarassed too..) It was clearly someones half dryed semen!!!!Me and the night porter, we changed the sheet together....in silent.
Reviews.Author: onigiri2

Reviews.Content: Highly Avoidable AVOID this hotel... We stayed in this hotel on Nov 28-29, 2003. When we came in the afternoon they said our room will be ready in the evening and therefore we should come back later. However, when we came back late night we were told that the room we were supposed to stay in, was having some water leak problems. To be fair, they did offer a choice to us to move to a different hotel which was 20 minutes away. Since we were too tired, we settled for staying in Ascot itself, provided they move us to a different room the next day.. t was a bad decision to stay there. The carpet was wet and the bathroom outlet was clogged and the room was stinking. There was no way that problem must have happened that day. It must be a permanent issue with that room and we were mad that why did they not tell us in the afternoon that the room was seedy. Throughout the night, the doors of other rooms kept banging and there seemed to be no soundproofing. The stink coupled with the noises did not allow us to sleep and left us cursing. The room we stayed in the next day was better and probably was their best room (we were shown a few other rooms and they also seemed to have a stink). I can not understand how they have got a three star rating. If some one know the address of the Italian hotel rating agency, please let me know. I would like to take it up with them.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: What a disaster! My wife and I, with a group of four friends who had recently retired, decided to enjoy the delights of Italy and planned a visit to Florence between the 8th and the 15th of October 2003. The hotel we happened to choose, was the Ascot Hotel. We pre-paid for six nights and were looking forward to enjoy the relative comforts of a three star hotel. Whilst the hotel is conveniently situated near the Santa Maria Novella railway station and lots of other attractions, our misgivings started on arrival. We arrived about lunchtime and were graciously offered to make use of one of our allocated rooms to store our luggage and refresh ourselves. There was a small lift to room 201 and before entering we noticed a rather rank smell in the reception area, which seems to originate from the sewers of the town. The corridors had wallpaper peeling off the walls, but whilst the bedroom was adequately sized for a double, it was shabby, carpet was threadbare, bedside light was not working and a number of slats were lying under the bed instead of supporting the mattress centre. The outlook was to a dismal backyard with broken railings, however we did not intend to spend a lot of our precious time in the bedroom or the hotel. On entering the small bathroom I observed shelves just loosely hanging from the mouldy, grimy tiles, a cracked hand wash basin, a shower hose with no shower rose and a centre drain with a broken metal grid. Our first purchases in Florence were at the chemist for bleach, disinfectant, air-freshener and mosquito spray. Being in high spirits, we then looked at some of the delightful attraction in the vicinity and planned our week ahead before retiring to our rooms and discovering a handful of cockroaches. The following morning we made our way to the breakfast room and found nothing! No clean tables, no crockery, no cutlery, no glasses, no bread, no juices, no coffeeetc, etc..absolutely pron nulla! The one member of staff on duty was one woman who seemed to be overwhelmed by our requests for anything. Her reply due minuto was an automatic response followed by her departure into the background and her eventual reappearance with a couple of hot glasses (for 6!) straight from the dishwasher for juice or some other single item of food. We began to feel sorry for her and the apparent shortage of equipment she had to deal with, we decided to have our breakfast earlier the following day to avoid the rush hour. However, we found nothing had changed and we had a repeat performance from the previous day, only to be told when requesting utensils or food cinque minuto and to sitta downe. We decided to mention the shortcomings at the reception desk and found the three following mornings a plethora of equipment and glut of food available as well as two members of staff working and were quite pleased with ourselves for having resolved the problema. It was however a short-lived gratification, the last day of our stay was a repeat performance of the first couple of days and our complaints to the receptionist on duty resulted in a confrontational row with a hostile breakfast waitress. On the second day the lift also ceased to function and was only repaired by the evening of our 6th and last night. At no time did a representative of the management approach us and we decided to write to them instead and also contact the Florence tourist board to enable them to review their rating system.If this hotel had been in the UK, I would take them to court.Would we recommend the Ascot Hotel? Decidedly: NO!!!S.H.F. Gudd.P.S Our last night in Italy was spent at the *** Hotel Terminus  Plaza in Pisa and deserves full praise for providing comfort, facilities and a breakfast fit for a king for the same money.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Cannot Recommend This Hotel This hotel was less than ideal. All the printed and website information says that the hotel has been recently rennovated but it certainly does not look like it has. It was very hot in Florence in July when I was there and one of the reasons I chose the hotel was because it had airconditioning. The airconditioner in the room made a lot of noise but no cold air came out of it. The entire hotel was hot! After a day of walking in the heat it would have been nice to take a cold shower but even the water was hot. The bathroom was not nice at all and had a moldy smell to it. The carpet in the room looked like it had not been vaccumed in a while. The breakfast was standard and the staff were nice but did not seem like they really had the ability to do much. I'm sure there are other hotels in the city that offer comparable prices with better ammenities. I would not stay there again even if the weather was not as hot.
